Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Norman1golf
Reviews.Content: Had a terrible experience here nothing good to say and had my converter stolen From my van 250 bill.Will not stay there again they really didn't seem to care what had happen to us.

Reviews.Title: “Theft”
Reviews.Content: Do not park your car there unless you do not care if it is in one piece when you get back. My catylatic converter was stole. Thhe staff on duty does not know how to review the video, what little bit we were able to see was poor quality of the long term Parking. Return from the Airport wait was almost an hour when they said 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “This place is horrible”
Reviews.Author: Goodbeer7
Reviews.Content: Stayed their super bowl weekend . $1980.00 For 3 nights ... I somewhat understand with super bowl n all . What I can't understand is the hotel is a pig sty . My first room had a leak in bathroom ceiling with mold . We switched to anther room n it was a little better . TV in both room gets about 10 channels , no sports n is fuzzy . My room was never vacuumed in 3 days . Had 2 towels . Place should b shut down ... If your not getting paid to stay then your getting robbed . I'm not exaggerating ... I have been driven to write 2 reviews in my life n this is #2 . I don't want anyone to get duped like I did .

Reviews.Title: “Six hours was to long”
Reviews.Author: itsnevercoldthere
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we needed a quick place to sleep, a place to park, and transportation to the airport. I booked the hotel online through their website a couple of months before we were to arrive. The problems started as soon as we got there. It wasn't the nicest looking place, but that wasn't to big of a deal since we were only staying for about six hours. When I went to check in at the front desk, no one was up there. I seen a reflection of some lady chowing down on some hot wings in the back. I waited patiently for about five minutes. Finally she noticed I was there. They had already assigned me a room. I asked what time the shuttle ran to the airport and she responded I was not booked for that package. I knew I was as I was very careful to make sure I did on their website. The lady was very quick to get rude. I could tell she was the kind of person that was looking for an arguement, so I told her it must of been my mistake, could she please help us out since we had traveled about 120 miles. It worked, so that was nice. Although, it shouldn't have been an issue since that is what I booked. The next issue was the room. Wow. It was very old, dated, and dirty. We left our luggage in the bathroom hoping that any bugs/bedbugs generally do not travel to those areas. The worst part was the rooms smell. That musty, foul, mildew type smell. With only six hours, it wasn't worth trying to get a new room. We needed what little time we had to catch a few z's. I would imagine most rooms were like this anyway. It would have been nice if we could have slept. This place is close to the airport, but there must be no sound insulation to deaden the noise. It litterly sounded like the planes were about to crash through the window. The final thing is the beds. Dear God. Please know that I am not making this up, I have slept on concrete this is more comfortable than their beds. I could take about laying in one position for about 10 minutes. After that I would just ache and have to turn. I would guess these are the original beds that have been in the hotel since it was built. On a positive note, the transportation was quick and on time. The ride back was a different story at 2 am when the driver was an hour late, but that is a different story. Overall, spend a few extra dollars and stay at a better hotel. It's well worth it to have a few hours sleep and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Alex and staff”
Reviews.Author: Rick G
Reviews.Content: My business networking group has weekly meetings at this hotel. Alex and his staff have always been very friendly and accomodating. They always make sure we have what we need for our meetings. The service has always been outstanding. The hotel is centrally located which allows my members to meet at a location that is convenient for all. My members are always comfortable with the atmosphere which allows us to have very productive meetings. Rick G.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, Alex”
Reviews.Author: Monica M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice on my recent trip to the US. The manager, Alex, and his staff were really really helpful to me. It was my first trip to the US and they helped me find cabs and limos and got me to the local Post Office so I could pst stuff home. The breakfast which was included in the price of the room was delicious with second helpings of everything available. The room was comfortable and very clean. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: les527
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at this hotel while in town for a racing event at Lucas Oil Raceway. The price was very affordable, and the hotel staff was friendly and extremely helpful. Had dinner in the hotel restaurant; food was good and the service was great. Yes, the decor may be a little dated, but overall, it's a nice hotel. The common areas were all neat, clean, and well maintained. Our room was comfortable and clean. Even though there was a private party in the lounge and a large group staying in the hotel, the hotel was quiet. For the price, I was very pleased with my stay, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!”
Reviews.Author: Jon L
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation with this hotel and then cancelled the next day once I read the pretty pathetic reviews on tripadvisor. I was given a cancellation number by the hotel staff. About a month later I was charged for the night that I had cancelled. Called the hotel numerous times to discuss my refund which went nowhere because no one apparently had the authority to reverse the charge. They took my contact information and I was told they would return my call. Never happened. I finally reached someone with the ability to do something about this and was told that they weretoo busy and would contact me. Never did. So, I finally had to go to my credit card company to file a fraud claim and have been temporarily credited while they investigate. Morale of the story......when you read these reviews, wonder to yourself, "Can so many people be wrong about this hotel?" Trust me, we're not. Ended up staying at LaQuinta in Plainfield prior to our trip. Beautiful room and timely shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “I won't come back”
Reviews.Author: Erin075
Reviews.Content: The cable tv was horrible, the desk clerk was no help when asked for a guide of channels, they didn't have one. The bath tub had dirt left in it. Has every cable channel but ESPN, MSNBC (horrble FOX News and CNN). The internet is slow. There is nothing out by here, no fast food. It was close to the speedway but not worth it even the cheaper rates. Clerk said she'd reset the cable as some channels weren't working. This seriously is nothing like other Days Inns I have stayed in. This place is a nap town nightmare. The ice machines weren't working either on a very hot day.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel was an 84 dollar joke”
Reviews.Author: deezee57
Reviews.Content: horrible hotel, elec plug hanging out of wall, dead ants on register, sink handle leaked, towel bar was laying on floor, toilet rocked when you sat, sheets were paper thin. didn't even want to cover up the bedding was so dirty. front desk did not care. they just said sorry. the whole place was a dump. no restaurant, no pol ( had green slime all over it.) they now call them days hotel not days inn. don't know what that means. I only wish i wasn't so late so i could have moved to another hotel. Believe me i did not get any sleep in this dump. the only good thing about this hotel was the shuttle service was prompt.

Reviews.Title: “This is a hotel??? Seriously? Cannot possibly be a Days Inn!”
Reviews.Author: BadDiver
Reviews.Content: Needed a place near the airport the night before our return trip. Found a coupon for this in one of the travel magazines. My first tip-off should have been that the sign on the building said "Days Hotel", not "Days Inn", even though the Days Inn logo was used. Upon entering the lobby --- no air conditioning. Front desk clerk was surly at best. Sign on door that the restaurant, lounge and pool were all closed. Got a room on the second floor. No air conditioning in the hallway, although once in the room we were able to cool it down. There was a coffee pot in the room, so that was a plus. None of the exercise equipment worked. Ice machine only on alternate floors (not ours). Towels were paper thin. Had to keep my socks on, as I was afraid to walk on the carpet. I don't know what else to say about this abysmal property, except that they really should have PAID ME to stay there. The whole place was like a ghost town; I held my breath every time I used the elevator, hoping that I wouldn't get stuck. They really need to take down the "best of" signs awarded to them in the past by Days Inn; the whole place looks like it's ready to just crumble. Does Days Inn know that this property still uses their logo, and has Days Inn signs in the rooms? I'm assuming they lost their franchise, but are still advertising to travelers as though they are operating under the Days Inn flagship. YUCK!!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is the hole that feces extrudes from.”
Reviews.Author: Maclaird
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I have ever sayed at. The decoration of the rooms reminded me of a Soviet era housing unit. Cracks and stains on the wall and a 40 watt buld hanging from the ceiling. The bathroom was filthy and the elevator was a 2 person coffin sized death trap. We stayed one night in this fleabag and then transferred 25 miles away to the airport and drove in rather than suffer through this place. My firend got his credit card information stolen by the desk clerk who used it to buy pizza and porn online.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: twins5300
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on our way to visit Indiana University. The hotel was older and right up against the highway. Box springs were shot but top mattress somewhat ok. I was afraid to walk on the carpet without my shoes on. It was pretty bad and the bathroom looked clean, but smelled like it was cleaned with an old rag. No microwave or mini-fridge provided - which I like to have. I paid $69 for the night but felt I was overcharged by $30. This is basically what you get around the airport? I thought I could do better for $69. Breakfast was included - coffee, juice, one cereal out, many bagels, small sweet rolls, grits/gravy. No fruit or yogurt. The Lady attending to the breakfast was very nice and would wait on you a little. Workers all friendly. However, the rooms need major updating and I would not stay here again - sorry! Unless they lowered the prices or I was desperate!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: osumom31
Reviews.Content: Blood on blanket and comforter, bugs, no internet connection, horrible front desk service!! Checked in and checked out in 30 minutes!!!! Moved to a hotel that appreciates customers and cleanliness!!! Don't waste your money here!!

Reviews.Title: “If you need internet stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: scodic
Reviews.Content: Not a good hotel for anyone needing good internet connection. Goes down every hour or so. Location is bad nothing close by. Poor job of snow removal

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: tomgf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four days for the Moto GP races and were extremely satisfied. The rooms as well as the whole facility was spotless. Very nice Outdoor pool. Nice breakfast, too. Most of all, the staff was fantastic. Always very happy to assist, whatever your needs. I saw a review elsewhere saying the side facing the highway could be noisy, but we were on that side and never noticed anything

Reviews.Title: “SO bad I'd give it zero stars if I could”
Reviews.Author: k99js06
Reviews.Content: I attempted to stay here while in town for a quick wedding this summer. The wedding was downtown, but my flight home Sunday was early, so I thought an airport hotel would be more economical. Well, I'm sorry I ever did business with this horrible, despicable establishment. I arrived there at 11am (after waiting about 20 minutes for the airport shuttle to arrive) and requested to check in early. The front desk attendant said no, they could not accommodate an early check-in unless I wanted to pay for a second night (!). How extremely rude! I explained that I would be leaving the hotel at 4am the next morning, so I wouldn't even be staying there for a *full* night's stay, let alone *TWO* nights. I had flown in on an early morning flight and was tired and wanted to rest up before the wedding I was to attend that night downtown, so could I please check in? "No, sorry, the rules apply to you just like they do any customer" - that was their response. I asked to speak with management, who said THE SAME THING. There is *nothing* around this heap of junk hotel, so I'm not sure if they wanted me to sleep in the lobby or what (??). Also, the official check-in time on my Priceline receipt was 2:00, and the hotel said they would not check me in until 3:00. I was *fuming* mad, and asked them to take me back to the airport terminal, where I took the $7 shuttle into downtown and stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn (which was lovely) instead. Yes, I lost my $50 to this horrible, no good, poorly managed junk heap of a hotel, but I promised to write them a very "honest" review on Trip Advisor for all the "trouble" they went to for me. Do NOT stay here under any circumstances; the management are swindling pennypinchers who have no interest in hospitality or accommodating their guests. The hotel is also dark, dank and icky. Give it a miss, even if it means spending more.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle to/ from airport, lounge and large pool”
Reviews.Author: godfear
Reviews.Content: We missed our flight traveling through indianapolis airport. Airline give us some numbers for local hotel, after calling many hotels we did find one hotel that have 24 hour shuttle. Our stay was very good. Kids enjoyed in pool and i enjoyed football game in lounge on large screen tv. Next day after having hot breakfast got shuttle back to airport. Although we were very upset beacuse of our flight but with hotel experience we forget all that . Staff were very helpful they even provided us shuttle to local CVC .

Reviews.Title: “Go to a different hotel"”
Reviews.Author: cdiana2
Reviews.Content: Every time we traveled out of Indianapolis Airport, we stayed at Days Inn and left our car as part of a park and fly package. The staff were helpful. It was a great value, wonderful complimentary breakfast, easy to get to. But, all that's changed now!!!!!!! The hotel is very difficult to get to because of major highway construction and the location of the new Indianapolis Airport. We should have known when we arrived: it was newly named Days Hotel. When we returned from our trip, we were on Mountain time and didn't feel like eating early. The woman at the desk (only worker at desk--desperately busy) told us the restarurant closed at 10:00 pm. We got there at 9:05 pm and restaurant was closed. So, we tried to order food from leaflet in room--didn't work--called desk, "oh, that number doesn't work, come down and I'll give you more numbers to call." It was close to midnight when we the most horrible, greasy, expensive, food arrived. Exhausted from traveling, after noisy night (highway and air conditioner) we arrived at restaurant for breakfast at 9:05 am to find it closed. A man in elevator told us it was closed for a week. Back in room, clerk called at 11:05 am and asked us if we weren't staying another day, we should leave. Checkout was at 11:00!! Not posted anywhere. It's true what others write--drive right past this hotel. Too bad, it used to be be so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service; safety hazard”
Reviews.Author: Indyfanforever
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Indy 500 and had a reservation at Sleep Inn, located about 4 miles from Days Inn/Days Hotel. (Not sure why Days Inn was being called Days Hotel; also, see related Sleep Inn review.) Upon arrival at Sleep Inn we were told that we were being sent to Days Inn. When we arrived at Days Inn and I explained that I had reserved a motel (Sleep Inn) that was 2 miles from the track (walking distance) and that this motel was not 2 miles from the track, the response was that this was not their problem and that they had nothing to do with Sleep Inn. A few minutes later, staff told us that both motels have the same owner. We had also been told that a management/ownership change had occurred about a month ago. Then we were told that Days Inn was charging us nothing. I asked, "Nothing at all?" and was told that Sleep Inn would be charging us its rate instead. Found out after the fact that Sleep Inn's rates are higher than Days Inn's rates. I asked for the manager's/owner's name/business card and was told to come back in an hour when they were less busy. At 5 am, I was awakened by dripping and saw that water was leaking from the ceiling in the bathroom. Within a few minutes, the lights in the bathroom went out bcause of so much water. Went to the front desk and explained what happened. The front-desk person started telling me that this was not their fault and the owner did not know what shape the motel was in when it was bought. The owner's business problems did not interest me; I told the front desk we needed another room. First, she told me she had another room and then said she didn't. She made no further attempt to resolve anything. I replied that it was a safety hazard and that she needed to find a room now. Her response: "Patience." She seemed to be inconvenienced. (The place was deserted at 5 am; I can't imagine what would be of higher priority.) I asked if there was a maintenance person. Response: "In the morning." I told her I did not want my family to be electrocuted in our bathroom and that she needed to find a room now. Response: "Patience." I kept insisting--actually, I threatened to call the police due to safety concerns--so she shuffled through a stack of papers and gave me the room of a "no-show." We spent from 5 am to 6 am on race day moving our belongings to another room 3 floors below the first room. Second room was stinky, gave us headaches, smelled of mold or maybe cigarettes (it was a non-smoking room). Our first room had 2 double beds; second room had only one king bed--for 3 people. Both rooms had sloppy tile jobs in the bathroom; seemed to be a repair of some sort. Possibly due to a leak? Elevators were old, rickety, and finicky. Not much selection at the breakfast buffet. The milk ran out and was eventually refilled. Eggs were promised several times but did not arrive until we were almost finished eating. Around 8:45 am, one employee said she was going to cut off breakfast at 9 am, even though breakfast was supposed to run until 9:30. It appeared they were running out of food. We went to the front desk again and were told that someone would call us about our room problems. The employee, who called herself "management," asked for the best phone number at which to reach me. I asked when someone was going to call. She responded that I was giving her a hard time and said she hoped I wouldn't give the owner as much of a hard time as I was giving her. I clarified that I could not give her a phone number until I knew when they would call because the number depended on which day they were calling. Then she started arguing with me. Every encounter with her was an argument. The employee from 5 am, who was there later that day, said that the leak occurred because the people in the room above us clogged up the drains, left the water on, and left the room. It was our turn to say, "Not my problem." Every statement we made and every valid complaint we had was met with irritation and variations of responses such as, "Not my problem," "Don't take it out on me," or "Later." Pardon me, I did not read the manual on how to voice a complaint so as not to offend the employees--when there is an emergency. The first response should have been profuse apologies. No apology of any sort was given until we were walking out the door to check in to another motel. That apology came from the only employee we encountered who had even a partial sense of responsibility. We stayed only one night out of three and only stayed that night because who can find a motel room in Indianapolis at 5 am on race day? As it was, we barely made it to the race in time and missed some pre-race activities. It is now 4 days later, and still no one has called us. Also, there was an outdoor pool, but the water was green. This motel is run-down, and the response from most of the staff to problems is that it is the customer's fault and the customer's problem. And if a safety hazard occurs, the customer has to be "patient" at 5 am in their pajamas in the lobby. "In the morning" is apparently when they address safety hazards. This motel is not a good value, even if it were free.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!”
Reviews.Author: McQs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is TERRIBLE!! Trip Advisor mysteriously has a good rating for this RUN DOWN WORN OUT heap called a "hotel". The room was straight fro the 70's and dirty, with a soaking wet shag carpet from the leaking a/c. It was dark and dismal. Don't stay here for ANY REASON, even if it's free. It was so depressing. The pool was old & awful and the shallow end was 4 feet so my young children couldn't even swim because they couldn't touch. AND it's a long convoluted way to get to the airport. FIND SOMEWHERE ELSE, ANYWHERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable, Not as good anymore for airline passengers”
Reviews.Author: WantaTellya
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and comfortable. While it used to be at the airport, the new terminal is now 7 miles away. We used the Park 'n Fly service which doesn't work as well anymore. The shuttle service goes only once an hour. We were actually left because we were only a few minutes early and saw it going down the road (it came back for us). When we got back to the airport after our trip, we found that the hotel was not on the shuttle service kiosk and our cell phone would not work in the airport to call their bus. We would recommend it as a decent, reasonable place to stay, but the Park 'n Fly service did not work.

Reviews.Title: “I won't stay here again...!!”
Reviews.Author: Coast2Coast12
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the rates, reviews and proximity to the Indianapolis airport...I regretted it from the moment I arrived. The hotel lobby was dark, musty and dated and my impression of the hotel only got worse from there. When I arrived in the room it was of adequate size but everything from the carpeting to the TV and bedding were very worn and dated. The noisy AC unit turned out to be a Godsend since it drowned out most of the noise from the interstate just outside. When I turned on the TV there was nothing but static. Upon checking the back of the unit I discovered that the cable had fallen (or been ripped) from the back of the unit. It was stripped from its coupling and couldn't just be re-threaded. I called the front desk and someone came up and jammed it back into the socket until it finally worked. When I turned on the shower rusty, brown water spewed out of the faucet for a few seconds before it finally ran clear. The mattress was the most uncomfortable thing I have ever slept on and I woke with a sore back from the hard lumpy surface. If I hadn't checked in at such a late hour and wasn't as exhausted as I was, I would have left and found someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport and Interstate,but with no sound!!”
Reviews.Author: Calypso4473
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in Indy to visit Zoo and Childrens Meusem and chose this motel because of close proximity to both.Very pleased with everything-from desk staff,housekeeping to the people who worked in the breakfast area/resturant downstairs.Didn't use the park-n-fly feature,so I can't comment on that.The pool was wonderful for a refreshing dip after a long day of sight seeing.We stayed on the top floor and loved both watching the sunrise and sunset from our window.

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed here twice-and had been wonderfully pleased both times”
Reviews.Author: RWroth
Reviews.Content: One of the times we stay here was during a blinding snowstorm. They took great care of us and goddess to the Airport on time even with 2 inches of snow per hour. The staff was as gracious and friendly as any we have met anywhere and we have stayed in all 50 states and over 55 countries! The restaurant was great; the facilities are not plush; but I don't think there's a better buy for the buck in Indianapolis. Professor Emeritus Wally Roth We are recommended this hotel to a number of friends for staying before and after trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: gpstet
Reviews.Content: The motel was very clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Great value for your buck. We had the park and fly package. Shuttle service was also great!!

Reviews.Title: “Park & Fly deal not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: letsgo36
Reviews.Content: Before booking a stay at this motel thru Expedia, I called them direct. They gave me a rate of $97 & told me they had free Park & Fly privilege - if you spent one night you could park your vehicle free for up to 7 days while you flew in & out of Inpls airport. I then went online to Expedia & booked the room for $74. When we got to the motel they wanted to charge me for Park & Fly because I didn't book the room thru them. So my question is, "Is their Park & Fly privilege FREE or not?" After a little discussion, the clerk ended up giving me Park & Fly at no add'l charge however, and she was friendly & understanding thru it all. Their free shuttle to & from the airport was timely & the drivers friendly. We did not use their breakfast as the timing didn't work out. The room was fine but noisy, as we heard interstate traffic & planes all night. I would use the motel again though, because even with ahigher price the Park & Fly is cheaper than parking at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I expected.”
Reviews.Author: quiltingtravelmom
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews, I thought this would be the perfect hotel for us, since we had an early flight the next morning. The free shuttle was great. We did not use the parking, but I will remember it if we ever need to return. The room was large, wake up call was right on time, the beds were comfy. Free WiFi was nice, though a bit slow. But, I'm afraid that's where the compliments end. The room smelled pretty bad - kinda musty - but was better when the A/C was on. It was not as quiet as the previous rater said. I heard trucks and airplanes alot. There was no microwave or fridge in our room. I thought we would have one. No bathroom fan, so made the second person's experience not so pleasant. Breakfast was free, but started too late for my friend to eat there. When I went, the biscuits and gravy were good, but the eggs were undercooked, the coffee was not very good, and the milk tasted VERY funny - almost spoiled. The only thing left was carbs. The vacuum cleaners were banging on my door well before 0900, even though I had a do not disturb sign posted. So, all in all, it was alright. But, not the "great" hotel I expected from the other ratings. Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Jumping off point.”
Reviews.Author: siuwed
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Days Inn airport with a stay a night and park for a week package while going on vacation for a week and flying out of Indianapolis. The Hotel is dated, and the highway noise is loud, but honestly the stay was great. The staff was friendly and helpful, the place was clean, breakfast was well above average with the hot food, and the shuttle service to and from the airport is gold. No problems with my vehicle after being parked there a week and all was just fine. Highly recommended for the price, I paid $75.00, stayed one night, two people, ate breakfast, was taken to the airport and retrieved when I got back a week later, and parked for a week. That's a GREAT DEAL!

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: smoky1
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the day's inn new year's eve. check in was quick the room was very clean. the lounge was very nice even though the bartender was also working in the dining room.the breakfast was real nice-biscuits and gravy and scrambled eggs were great!! overall a nice quiet place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: 51st
Reviews.Content: Travelled from New Zealand for a family wedding in Indianapolis and stayed 5 nights. Staff were friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. Decore in rooms is starting to date however for the price no complaints as they are clean and serviced daily. Enjoyed our complimentary continental breakfast, there was plenty to choose from and waitress helpful. Recommended to family who have since stayed here and enjoyed experience. Complimentary shuttle to airport great.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough”
Reviews.Author: pete707
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Days inn for one night after flying from Vegas to St louis then Indianapolis,unfortunaly i did'nt get to the hotel untill 11pm so the bar,pool etc were closed.But check in was easy and the room was fine.This was a nice hotel for the night.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On January 27, 2006, my husband, 6-year old son and myself set off to Indianapolis to fly to Orlando, Florida on vacation. Because our flight was leaving at 8AM on January 28th, we decided to stay the night at a hotel near the airport and do "Park & Fly" for the week that we were gone. I had called on January 26th to make a reservation at Days Inn for the following night. At the time I asked about the Park & Fly rate and was told that they offered 7 nights free parking with one nights stay. I was given a total of $96.43 (including taxes and fees) for one non-smoking room with two double beds, two adults and one child, and were guaranteed late arrival. We arrived at Days Inn at 11PM on January 27, 2006. My son was asleep in the back seat, so I went in alone to check-in and my husband stayed in the van. When I gave the clerk at the desk my name, he said that they didn't have a reservation for me. I gave him the confirmation number and he said that they had me in the system for the 26th, not the 27th. I told him that there was a mistake on their part and asked if they had a room for us that night. The clerk said they did but he would have to charge me an additional $25 to leave our vehicle there for 7 nights. I asked about the free parking with one nights stay, and he said that we weren't booked with the Park & Fly rate. The Park & Fly rate evidently costs more, so in the end the parking really isn't free. Because it was so late and we were all so tired, I didn't really have a choice. So I paid the additional money and finished checking in. When I went back out to the van to unload our luggage and get the rest of my family, I found my husband standing outside of our van with an upset look on his face. He said that while I was inside, a Days Inn shuttle bus had hit our van with my husband and son IN it. The driver's name was Mary and she didn't seem to be bothered with what had just happened. She said that she tried to squeeze between our van and the curb, but there just wasn't enough room. My first concern was that my husband and son were okay. They were shaken up but seemed unharmed. I then looked at the incredible damage down the side of my van, and then went back in to talk to the front desk. By now the man that had been helping me was gone and a lady was there. I told her what happened and she got on the phone and called he General Manager, Dennis Anderson, at home. He said that all of the insurance information was locked in his office and no one else had a key. I asked why the insurance information was not in the shuttle bus, but he had no answer. He said that he would get me a copy of everything in the morning. I told him that we were leaving at 6AM the next morning to catch our flight, and asked if he would be in that early. He said no, but he would make a copy of everything for me and leave it at the front desk for me to pick-up when we got back on February 3. I said okay, but that I was going to call the police so that there would be a report on file. The girl at the desk told me that calling the police wasn't really necessary. I stood my ground and told her that at the very least, my insurance company would want a police report. So she called 911 and asked for a Sheriff to come out. The Sheriff got there within 30 minutes and took a report. I overheard Mary, the bus driver, telling him that she didn't do the damage to the front of my van - only the damage to the back. I immediately jumped in and asked her how on earth she believed that she didn't do ALL of the damage? She said she didn't know, but just knew that she didn't do it all. I'm not sure if she was saying that because she was scared of losing her job, or what. So, I decided that arguing with her was pointless and went back in to speak with the lady at the front desk to order a wake-up call for 5AM the next day. I mentioned to her that it would be very hospitable for the hotel to comp part if not all of our room cost, since the accident had caused us a LOT of inconvenience. She told me that she was already working on it with her manager, and that she felt bad about what happened. The next morning I went to the front desk, and the same lady told me that her Manager told her that we could take it up any comps with their insurance company. If they think we deserve anything extra we can get it from them. ?!?!? My mouth dropped open and I told her that I was blown away by that comment. I didn't have time to say much else because we had to leave for the airport. When we got back on February 3rd, it was again late at night. The same lady was at the front desk that was there when we checked in. I asked her for the envelope that was supposed to be left with me with their insurance company information enclosed. She said that Dennis must have forgotten to leave it because there wasn't anything there for me. She called him again at home, and he told her to tell me that the insurance company is Fireman's Fund, and gave me the toll free number. He told her to tell me that he would call us at home the next day with more detailed information. At that point I asked her what Mr. Anderson's boss's name is because I was going report this whole situation to the Days Inn Corporate Office and to his superior. The lady at the desk then told me that Mr. Anderson doesn't really have a superior for me to contact. I then told her that at the very least I would be contacting the Days Inn Corporate office with my complaint. Today is February 15, 2006, and my van is still not fixed. I have been communicating with Fireman's Fund Insurance since we got back, and they are disputing that their driver caused all of the damage. An investigation is under way and I should hopefully have resolution by tomorrow at the latest. I guarantee that if ALL of the damage done to my van by the shuttle bus doesn't get repaired, I will turn everything over to my attorney and we can take this to court. This has got to me the most blatant example of awful customer service that I have ever experienced in my life! My husband and I travel quite a bit and have always trusted Days Inn as a quality place to stay. Now I have serious doubts about ever using Days Inn again. I know for sure that I will never again use the Indianapolis location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the safe feeling”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to stay at this motel.I always stayed at another one in the same area.The price was right,very clean,friendly,and they even called after I was in my room to see if everything was alright. I have told a couple people about my stay and they stayed also. I will stay again. I am a single woman that travels alone and I feel very safe at your motel.I will be calling for reservations next week when I get a ticket to Florida. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Stay, Park & Fly a great value.”
Reviews.Author: LONG3
Reviews.Content: We did the Stay, Park & Fly at the Days Inn on a recent trip to Maui. The room was clean and fine for our one night stay. We left our car for a week and the car was just as we left it when we returned. Staying and parking at the hotel was a great value and very stress free. The shuttle took us right to the airport door and picked us up after our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Park, Stay and Fly Option!”
Reviews.Author: OhioAlwaysTravelin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and fly out of Indianapolis Airport to Orlando Florida. The reason we stayed here is because of the feature Park Stay and Fly!!! Very Neat Feature here! The cost was only 80.00!! Other area hotels for this option was over $100.00! First of all, the hotel is located very convienently near the airport. When we checked in, it was very fast! Also, the front desk even printed out our boarding passes for Southwest! I called other hotels and they did not do that! Very pleased with this hotel! The rooms were ok, like any other hotel room. It was very clean, the showers were very nice as well! Again, no problem. They did have an outside pool but we were there so late and had to get up so early! This hotel even offers complimentary breakfast starting at 7:00am. We had to be gone by 6:00a so we didn't get to eat there. Checking out was just as fast as checking in! After we checked out, we just walked outside and waited about 10 minutes and boom there was a shuttle there waiting to take us to the airport! When we returned home, we just went to Ground Transportation, Hotel/Motel Pick up and called the Hotel and they were there to pick us up in 10 minutes on the shuttle! Luckily, we did the Park, Stay and Fly because when we got back to our car, our car would not start!!!! So a Hotel Staff Member helped us out with this as well! If we would have been stuck in the Economy Parking, we would have been stuck!! Very Impressed with this motel! Would definetely recommend!! A+++++
